NAEB HEADQUARTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
MEMORANDUM
TO: All NAEB Committee Chairmen
FROM: Mary Lynn Moody
Convention Coordinator
RE: Austin Convention
In September, we will run several extra pages in the Newsletter which
will contain information about the program format of the convention,
and, also, about meetings to be held during the three days, apart
from the regular schedule.
Although the Newsletter will not be sent to members until early
September, the copy must be in Betty McKenzie's hands by August 15,
at the latest. Therefore, if your committee plans to have a
meeting during the convention, would you please let me know right
away so that I may reserve a room for you — and so that the time and
place of the meeting can be announced in the Newsletter? The offi¬
cial dates of the convention are October 25-28; however, we expect
most people to arrive in Austin sometime on Sunday, October 24.
The Committees can meet anytime on that day. Also, we have left
Monday night, October 25, open for committee and regional meetings.
I will be leaving here on August 9 to talk with the hotel people
in Austin and to plan the pre-convention publicity with Betty.
We will need to know, by that time, what your meeting room needs
will be. Also, please remember that any information received later
than August 15 will be too late for the Newsletter.
If you have any questions, please get in touch with Mr. Hill or me.
mlm
July 24, 1964
